isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE SPEED AXLE: SPICER - REMOVE - CARRIER

step1.para: Remove drain plug and drain lubricant.
Disconnect drive shafts at rear U-joint.

note.para: If pinion or pinion bearings are to be removed, break loose pinion nut at this time.

step1.para: Remove axle shaft stud nuts and lockwasher, or cone locks if used. Remove axle shafts. If a gasket is assembled between the hub and shaft, discard the old gasket and replace with a new one at time of assembly.
Support the carrier assembly on a roller jack. Secure as necessary to prevent it from falling off the jack when removed from the housing.
Loosen the differential carrier-to-axle housing bolts. Remove all bolts except top two. These two bolts will prevent the carrier assembly from falling.

Install two 1/2 inch-13 bolts into threaded holes provided in carrier housing flange. Turn puller bolts in to break carrier away from housing. Be certain carrier is balanced properly on jack, and remove top two carrier mounting bolts. Remove carrier assembly from axle housing.

Mount carrier assembly in a suitable rebuild stand ( Figure 5). (Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS
.)

figure.caption: Figure 5. Mount Carrier Assembly in Suitable Rebuild Stand
